bibl.title: Letter from John R. Taylor to Philip Showalter Hench, February 19, 1942

div1.p: Taylor refers Hench to a paper by Sternberg.

div1.head: Letter from John R. Taylor to Philip Showalter Hench, February 19, 1942
div1.opener:
548 Grand Ave
Upper Darby, Pa
Feb 19, 1942.
Dr Phillip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester. Minn.
Dear Dr Hench
div1.p:
Your letter of Feb 16th received. Think it is good to
include Sternbergs work in your monograph. Have read several of his articles.
I hesitate to suggest anything, but now that I know of one subject that
you will cover, (Sternberg) am going to mention about the last paper
Sternberg wrote just a few weeks before his death. Through a coin-
cidence of Mrs Sternberg this paper was placed in the hands of
Dr George M. Kober only four days previous to the Proceedings
of the Second Pan-American Scientific Congress, held at the
New Ebbitt Hotel, Friday afternoon, Jan 7, 1916. I appear
to have omitted the city of the meeting, probably Washington D. C.
I copied the extracts of Sternberg from the Proceedings, as it
was read there. They appear to me to be very important to you.

Proceedings of the Second Pan-American Congress
Part II, p 645, General Session Section VIII.
New Ebbitt Hotel, ____, Friday afternoon
Jan 17, 1916.

If you are unable to get to see the copy of the Pproceedings,
and request it, will send you my copy of Sternbergs paper
extracted from the printed pages of the Proceedings. I just
forget the Library, I got it from.

In regards to the negatives, there is no hurry at all,
keep them as long as you want.

Dr Hench will be glad to see you at any time, but if I say
come right out to 548 Grand Ave, Upper Darby, you will
never find me. No it is not on the Main Line. The fact is,
I do not live in Upper Darby, but the postal authorities
insist that I have my mail addressed to Upper Darby.

I live out in the country, about nine miles from Philadelphia.
My correct address should be.

548 Grand Ave.
Bon Air
Upper Darby. Pa.
Delaware Co.
Telephone Hilltop 307-R
(Mary A. Butland)

Note that the telephone where I live is not listed in my name,
but in that of my Cousin Mary A. Butland

The best way is to telephone me when you get to Phila-
delphia and let me know where you are, and I could
come out for you. Anyhow, you would have to
telephone to the above phone (where I live) to make
sure that I was home. Pardon all this explanation,
but I live out in the country, and I know the trouble
you would have, unless I map it out, which I will
do if you wish. Am on the West Chester line of
trolleys, and you would have to get off at Eagle station
and my residence is about 12 minutes walk from the station
